title: Can the effect of Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin be activated by targeting a Ritual Beast Tamer Wen if another Ritual Beast Tamer Wen was already Special Summoned that turn?
question: Can the effect of Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin be activated by targeting a Ritual Beast Tamer Wen if another Ritual Beast Tamer Wen was already Special Summoned that turn?
answer: The effect of Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin can only be activated by targeting a "Ritual Beast" monster that has not yet been Special Summoned that turn. (If you do not have 2 banished "Ritual Beast" monsters that have not been Special Summoned that turn, you cannot activate the effect of Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin.)
llm_answer:
No, the effect of **Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin** cannot be activated by targeting a **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** if another **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** was already Special Summoned that turn. The effect text of **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** specifies that you can only Special Summon "Ritual Beast Tamer Wen(s)" once per turn. 

**Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin**'s effect to return itself to the Extra Deck and Special Summon two of your banished monsters would still trigger the "once per turn" restriction on **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen**. Therefore, if one **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** has already been Special Summoned, you cannot Special Summon another **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** using **Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin**'s effect during the same turn.

The scenario will resolve as follows:

- **Ritual Beast Ulti-Pettlephin** returns to the Extra Deck.
- You cannot target a second **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen** for Special Summoning because of the "once per turn" restriction on **Ritual Beast Tamer Wen**.
